info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 6:30PM EDT until July 09 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 630 PM EDT, Excessive runoff developed during heavy rain this afternoon. Minor flooding is already occurring at some locations in the advisory area. Addison Drive is probably inundated by up to a foot of rapidly flowing floodwaters, capable of picking up vehicles. Lincrest Place is likely inundated. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Floodwaters will slowly recede through mid-evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Pineville, Southpark Mall, Freedom Park, The Arboretum and The Plaza. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
